fast_hough_transform.console¶

Command-line interface.

fast_hough_transform.draw_line¶

Draw line module.

fast_hough_transform.draw_line.draw_line(image, start, thickness, height, width)¶

Draws a line on the input image.

Parameters:

  • image (np.ndarray) – The input image as a NumPy array.

  • start (int) – The starting position of the line.

  • thickness (int) – The thickness of the line.

  • height (int) – The height of the image.

  • width (int) – The width of the image.

Returns:

The modified image with the line drawn on it.

Return type:

np.ndarray

fast_hough_transform.draw_line.hough_transform(image, threshold_ratio=0.9, draw_lines=0)¶

Performs the Hough transform on the input image to detect lines.

Parameters:

  • image (np.ndarray) – The input image as a NumPy array.

  • threshold_ratio (float) – The threshold ratio for line detection. Defaults to 0.9.

  • draw_lines (int) – If not 0, the function will return the image with detected lines drawn on it. Defaults to 0.

Returns:

A tuple containing the maximum intensity found in the Hough space and either the Hough space array alone or along with the image with detected lines drawn on it.

Return type:

Tuple[float, np.ndarray] or Tuple[float, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

fast_hough_transform.hough_transform¶

Hough transform module.

fast_hough_transform.hough_transform.fast_hough_transform(Picture)¶

Performs a fast Hough transform on the input picture.

Parameters:

Picture (np.ndarray) – The input picture.

Returns:

The transformed picture.

Return type:

np.ndarray

fast_hough_transform.hough_transform.find_max_value(picture)¶

Finds the maximum value in the input picture and its corresponding coordinates.

Parameters:

picture (np.ndarray) – The input picture.

Returns:

The maximum value and its coordinates.

Return type:

Tuple[float, Tuple[float, float]]

fast_hough_transform.hough_transform.find_point(n, s, t)¶

Finds a point given specific parameters.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Parameter n.

  • s (float) – Parameter s.

  • t (float) – Parameter t.

Returns:

The calculated point.

Return type:

float

fast_hough_transform.hough_transform.merge_histograms(h1, h2)¶

Merges two histograms into one.

Parameters:

  • h1 (np.ndarray) – The first histogram.

  • h2 (np.ndarray) – The second histogram.

Returns:

The merged histogram.

Return type:

np.ndarray

fast_hough_transform.image_processing¶

Image processing module.

fast_hough_transform.image_processing.read_image(FOLDER, name)¶

Reads an image from the specified folder with the given name and performs resizing.

Parameters:

  • FOLDER (str) – The folder path where the image is located.

  • name (str) – The name of the image file.

Returns:

The resized image as a NumPy array.

Return type:

np.ndarray

fast-hough-transform
